alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe; Kipahulu; Lanai Leeward; Lanai Mauka; Lanai South; Lanai Windward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Central Valley South; Maui Leeward West; Maui Windward West; Molokai Leeward South; Molokai North; Molokai Southeast; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; South Haleakala; South Maui, Upcountry; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued July 18 at 4:55AM HST until July 19 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL TONIGHT FOR MAUI COUNTY... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH TONIGHT FOR THE HALEAKALA SUMMIT... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR MAUI COUNTY ... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE HALEAKALA SUMMIT ... .Strengthening winds will develop today in advance of Tropical Storm Calvin. These winds may become damaging later this evening through Wednesday afternoon as Calvin passes just south of the islands in Maui County. ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northeast winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts over 50 mph expected. For the High Wind Watch, northeast winds 30 to 45 mph with localized gusts to around 60 mph are possible. * WHERE...Portions of Kahoolawe, Lanai, Maui and Molokai. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 6 PM HST this evening. For the High Wind Watch, from this evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Take precautions now to protect property. Tie down loose objects or move them to a sheltered location.
